definition: to show off/to try to be brave
to show off/to flaunt/to carry out or succeed in a scheme/to indulge/to give free rein to
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
variant of 強|强[jiang4]
variant of 強|强[qiang3]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
variant of 強|强[qiang2]
surname Qiang
stubborn/unyielding

sentences.english: To mature, and who can know the inner childish?

sentences.english: She is fond of flaunting her superiority before her friends and schoolmates.
sentences.chinese: 她好在朋友和同学面前逞强。

sentences.english: Finally understand that strength is also a kind of strong.
sentences.chinese: 终于明白了逞强亦是一种坚强。

sentences.english: If you are ever in trouble do not try to be brave, just run just run away…

sentences.english: I think I was not so strong, but time and again is try to be brave.
sentences.chinese: 我想我没那么坚强，不过是一而再的逞强。

sentences.english: Have that a man can see through my try to be brave, just to protect my fragile.
sentences.chinese: 有一个人能看穿我的逞强，为了保护我的脆弱。

sentences.english: Russia but tell yourself and opposed Russian not away.

sentences.english: I want to protect vulnerable people, see through me try to be brave.
sentences.chinese: 希望有个人可以保护我的脆弱，看穿我的逞强。

sentences.english: Don't stretch beyond the point where you begin to feel tightness in the muscle.
sentences.chinese: 不要逞强去拉伸你觉得肌肉密实的部位。

definition: to show off one's ability/to boast one's merits
to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
to let emotions affect one's decisions
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
duplicity/hypocrisy (idiom)
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
reluctant to admit a mistake
weak/feeble/flabby
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
